definition: running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research

sentences.english: His military thought had historic and practical significance.
sentences.chinese: 他的治军思想具有历史意义和现实意义。

sentences.english: We will continue to run the army strictly in accordance with the law and raise its level of standardization.
sentences.chinese: 坚持从严治军，依法治军，提高军队正规化水平。

sentences.english: We will continue to run the army strictly in accordance with the law and raise its level of standardization.
sentences.chinese: 坚持从严治军，依法治军，提高军队正规化水平。

definition: to lead military operations with extraordinary skill
expert at appointing people according to their abilities (idiom)/to put the right people in the right places
lit. if he orders you go, he forbids you stop (idiom); fig. to demand exact compliance with instructions/to ensure strictly obedience
military orders are like mountains (idiom)/a military order must be obeyed
art of war/military strategy and tactics
strong soldiers/make the military powerful (political slogan)
